title: AI Podcast Assistant
summary: End-to-end pipeline that converts research PDFs into structured summaries and audio output, wrapped behind a Dockerized FastAPI service.
highlights: Implemented PDF ingestion: parsing, cleanup, and section-aware chunking to preserve context within prompt limits.
Designed prompt templates for consistent outputs (summary, key takeaways, section breakdown) and iterated quality via spot-checks.
Added reliability (logging, basic retries/error handling) and generated organized audio outputs with metadata/file tagging.
problem: Long research papers are time-consuming to read and hard to review on the go.
approach: Parse → clean/chunk → summarize → generate audio; expose the workflow via REST endpoints for reuse and UI integration.
contributions: Built ingestion, chunking, summarization orchestration, audio generation with edge-tts, and Dockerized FastAPI endpoints (upload, summarize, audio, fetch outputs).
results: Produced replayable audio summaries that speed up literature review and revision.
stack: Python, LangChain, FastAPI, Docker, edge-tts, PDF parsing, prompt templates, logging

title: Satellite Image Segmentation
summary: Desktop segmentation app that runs U-Net inference on satellite images and visualizes predicted masks through a simple GUI.
highlights: Trained a U-Net model with augmentation (flips/rotations + intensity changes) to improve robustness across terrain and lighting variation.
Built preprocessing pipeline (resize, normalization, format conversion) and streamlined inference for responsive local predictions.
Created a Tkinter GUI with input validation and clear errors; documented setup so the tool is easy to install and demo.
problem: Non-technical users needed an easy way to run segmentation on satellite images and visualize results without ML tooling.
approach: Train a U-Net in TensorFlow/Keras, build a preprocessing + inference pipeline, and wrap it in a lightweight desktop UI.
contributions: Implemented model training/inference, preprocessing, GUI workflow, validation/error handling, and installation documentation.
results: Delivered a reproducible desktop tool for quick segmentation demos and day-to-day experimentation on typical laptops.
stack: Python, TensorFlow/Keras, U-Net, augmentation, image preprocessing, Tkinter
